description:
About the Role
This in-person position will focus on both Project Coordination and Estimation responsibilities. This role will be responsible for coordinating several subcontractor pre-site visits and assessments collaboratively to establish quotes. This will be followed by project coordination responsibilities with a focus on quality control and customer service. Active account management will be key to your success.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Estimation Responsibilities

 Prepares work to be estimated by gathering proposals, blueprints, specifications and related documents. Identifies labour, material and time requirements by studying the relative documents.
 Frequent visits to site or as required for project quoting purposes.
 Computes costs by analyzing labour, material and time requirements.
 Presents prepared estimate by assembling and displaying numerical and descriptive information to management.
 Shares the maintenance of the cost at a base.
 Contributes to the team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
 Tender and bidding document take-offs.
 Other duties as required.

Project Coordinator Responsibilities

 Lead the planning and implementation of project.
 Facilitate the definition of project scope, goals and deliverables.
 Define and allocate project tasks and resource requirements.
 Develop full scale project execution plans.
 Manage pre-determined project budget and project resources.
 Schedule project timelines to align with customer and constructor requirements.
 Track project deliverables.
 Provide direction and support to Installation & Service Team.
 Quality assurance & quality control.
 Monitor and report on progress of the project to all stakeholders, including project changes.
 Present reports defining project progress, problems and solutions.

Education, Qualifications and Training
Education

 A Degree/Diploma/Certificate is an asset, but not necessary
 Certified engineering technologist certificate an asset

Experience and Knowledge

 A minimum of 2-5 years of relevant and successful work experience
 Valid G Class Driver’s License required
 Ability to obtain secret level II clearance is required
 Written and verbal bilingualism in French is a strong asset (not required)
 Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Office, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, SharePoint) with a strong proficiency in excel
 Previous experience in the service industry is an asset, but not necessary

Competencies

 Exceptional interpersonal, customer service and professional communication skills, verbal and written
 Strong time management and organizational skills to operate in a fast-paced environment
 Analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills
 Ability to work independently
 Interpersonal skills and conflict resolution
 Organizational skills
 Detail oriented
 Professional
 A drive for continuous learning

Hours

 Monday – Thursday (7:30AM - 4:30PM), Fridays (7:30AM - 3:30PM)
 In-person position only.

Salary

 Dependent on experience

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $55,000.00-$70,000.00 per year
Benefits:

 Casual dress
 Dental care
 Disability insurance
 Extended health care
 Life insurance
 On-site parking
 Paid time off
 RRSP match
 Vision care

Flexible Language Requirement:

 French not required

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Experience:

 construction estimating: 1 year (required)

Work Location: In person
